pkgmetadata.longdescription: # pyheckPyHeck is a case conversion library (for converting strings to snake_case, camelCase etc). It is a thin wrapper around the Rust library [heck](https://github.com/withoutboats/heck).[Read the documentation.](https://kevinheavey.github.io/pyheck/)## Installation```pip install pyheck```Note: requires Python >= 3.7.## Example```python>>> from pyheck import snake>>> snake("We carry a new world here, in our hearts.")'we_carry_a_new_world_here_in_our_hearts'```## Development### Setup1. Install [poetry](https://python-poetry.org/)2. Install dev dependencies:```poetry install```3. Activate the poetry shell:```shpoetry shell```### Testing1. Run `maturin develop` to compile the Rust code.2. Run `make fmt`, `make lint`, and `make test`.
